requirement_tested: Implement a 2048 game board with a 4x4 grid layout
user_persona: A casual gamer who enjoys puzzle games during breaks.
user_goal: To see a properly laid out 4x4 grid ready to start playing the 2048 game.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Website
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the browser and navigates to the 2048 game website. He expects to see the game board immediately.
narrative_steps.action: Load the webpage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A centered square game board appears with a linen background, containing a 4x4 grid of maroon-colored cells.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Initial Board State
narrative_steps.description: Alex looks at the grid to confirm it has been initialized correctly with two starting tiles.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the grid visually.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Two randomly placed tiles (with values 2 or 4) are visible on the grid,其余 cells are empty light maroon placeholders.

requirement_tested: Support tile movement in four directions: up, down, left, and right
user_persona: A frequent player familiar with classic 2048 controls.
user_goal: To move all tiles smoothly in any of the four directions using keyboard arrows.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Gameplay
narrative_steps.description: Jamie sees the initial board and decides to try moving tiles around first.
narrative_steps.action: Press the right arrow key.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All tiles shift towards the right edge of the grid, stopping either at the edge or before colliding with another tile.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Other Directions
narrative_steps.description: Curious about responsiveness, Jamie tries pressing other arrow keys quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Press ArrowUp, then ArrowLeft, then ArrowDown sequentially.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tiles respond accurately by shifting upwards, then leftwards, then downwards respectively with each keystroke.

requirement_tested: Enable merging of identical adjacent tiles during movement
user_persona: An experienced 2048 player aiming to build high-value tiles efficiently.
user_goal: To combine adjacent tiles of the same value and watch them merge into one higher-value tile.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Up Merge Scenario
narrative_steps.description: Taylor notices two horizontal tiles with matching numbers lined up and plans to merge them.
narrative_steps.action: Press the left arrow key to push tiles together.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The two adjacent identical tiles merge into a single tile whose value equals their sum, triggering a brief animation.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Result
narrative_steps.description: Taylor watches closely to verify that the merge happened correctly and the score updated.
narrative_steps.action: Watch the newly formed tile and the score display.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A new tile representing the combined value is shown, and the score increases by that amount instantly.

requirement_tested: Track and display the current score dynamically
user_persona: A competitive player focused on achieving high scores.
user_goal: To monitor how many points he gains with every successful merge.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Score Check
narrative_steps.description: Casey glances at the top panel to check his starting score before making any moves.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the score display element.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Score shows '0' above the game board.

narrative_steps.title: Making a Move That Scores Points
narrative_steps.description: After merging two tiles, Casey checks whether his score reflects the gain.
narrative_steps.action: Perform a tile merge by pressing an arrow key.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The score display updates in real-time to show the increased total based on the merged tile's value.

requirement_tested: Detect and handle game over state when no moves remain
user_persona: A meticulous tester checking edge cases of the game logic.
user_goal: To verify that the game detects when no more moves are possible and declares a loss.

narrative_steps.title: Playing Until Blocked
narrative_steps.description: Morgan keeps playing until the grid fills up with non-matching tiles, leaving no room for further moves.
narrative_steps.action: Continue making moves until the board is nearly full with mismatched tiles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Eventually, no directional inputs cause any tile movement or changes.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Game Over
narrative_steps.description: Morgan attempts one final move knowing it won’t work, expecting the game to recognize defeat.
narrative_steps.action: Press any arrow key once more.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The game transitions to game over state with a 'Game Over!' message appearing and the revive option becoming active.

requirement_tested: Allow users to start a new game at any time
user_persona: Someone wanting to practice strategies repeatedly without restarting the browser.
user_goal: To reset the game completely and begin afresh anytime during gameplay.

narrative_steps.title: Mid-Game Reset Decision
narrative_steps.description: Riley realizes she made a mistake early in the game and wants to restart from scratch.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'New Game' button located above the board.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire board resets, showing only two new random starting tiles and the score returns to zero.

requirement_tested: Provide a revive option after game over to continue playing
user_persona: A determined player unwilling to give up even after losing.
user_goal: To resume playing from the exact moment the game was lost instead of starting over.

narrative_steps.title: Encountering Game Over
narrative_steps.description: Jordan exhausts all possible moves and sees the 'Game Over!' message.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for the game over screen to appear.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Overlay dims the board and displays 'Game Over!' with a prominent 'Revive' button below.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing to Revive
narrative_steps.description: Instead of quitting, Jordan opts to keep going from where things went wrong.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Revive' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The game over overlay disappears, restoring the previous board configuration and re-enabling movement controls.

requirement_tested: Support winning condition when a tile reaches 2048 value
user_persona: An ambitious player striving to reach the ultimate goal of the game.
user_goal: To achieve a 2048 tile and receive recognition for completing the core objective.

narrative_steps.title: Building Toward Victory
narrative_steps.description: Casey carefully lines up tiles, working methodically toward forming a 2048 tile.
narrative_steps.action: Strategically merge tiles until one approaches 1024 and beyond.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Higher-valued tiles accumulate as planned.

narrative_steps.title: Achieving the Target Tile
narrative_steps.description: Finally, Casey makes the crucial move that creates the elusive 2048 tile.
narrative_steps.action: Merge two 1024 tiles by pressing an appropriate arrow key.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal pops up announcing 'You Win!' offering the choice to continue playing.

requirement_tested: Ensure all game logic runs client-side with no backend dependencies
user_persona: A privacy-conscious user who prefers apps that don't send personal data elsewhere.
user_goal: To enjoy uninterrupted gameplay without needing internet connectivity or worrying about remote processing.

narrative_steps.title: Playing Offline
narrative_steps.description: Sam loads the game while offline and begins playing, expecting everything to function normally.
narrative_steps.action: Open the game page without an active internet connection.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The game loads successfully and operates fully without requiring server communication.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Browser Activity
narrative_steps.description: While playing, Sam checks developer tools to ensure nothing is being sent externally.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser DevTools > Network tab and observe traffic.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: No network requests related to game state or logic are observed during normal play.

requirement_tested: Design UI components with maroon color scheme
user_persona: A designer evaluating consistency of brand aesthetics across interfaces.
user_goal: To confirm that all interactive and static UI elements use the specified maroon color palette.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Visual Elements
narrative_steps.description: Taylor examines various parts of the interface looking for uniformity in color usage.
narrative_steps.action: Scan visually across buttons, tiles, and panels.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All UI components utilize maroon tones consistently, aligning with the defined color palette.

requirement_tested: Set background color to linen as the primary background
user_persona: A user sensitive to visual comfort and contrast preferences.
user_goal: To experience a soothing background tone that enhances visibility of foreground elements.

narrative_steps.title: Noticing Overall Background Tone
narrative_steps.description: Jordan observes the general feel of the site upon landing on the homepage.
narrative_steps.action: View the entire screen’s backdrop.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The full viewport background is rendered in linen (#faf0e6), providing a warm off-white canvas.

requirement_tested: Include controls for starting new game and reviving game state
user_persona: A practical user seeking quick access to essential game functions.
user_goal: To easily find and use controls for resetting or continuing the game whenever needed.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Control Buttons
narrative_steps.description: Alex scans the top section of the game area for familiar action buttons.
narrative_steps.action: Look for labeled buttons near the top of the game board.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Two clearly labeled buttons—'New Game' and 'Revive'—are aligned horizontally above the board with consistent styling.

narrative_steps.title: Using Each Button Appropriately
narrative_steps.description: During gameplay and post-loss, Alex tests both buttons to understand their behavior.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'New Game' mid-play, then click 'Revive' after game over.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: 'New Game' resets everything immediately; 'Revive' becomes active only after loss and restores prior board state.

requirement_tested: Display game status including score, win/lose state
user_persona: An observant player who likes staying informed about ongoing game dynamics.
user_goal: To stay aware of current performance metrics and outcomes through clear status indicators.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Active Status Panel
narrative_steps.description: Riley focuses on the upper portion of the screen to track evolving game conditions.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the status panel throughout different stages of gameplay.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Score updates dynamically, and relevant win/loss messages appear promptly in designated containers.

requirement_tested: Maintain responsive design for desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: A multi-device user switching between phone and laptop regularly.
user_goal: To have the game adapt seamlessly to varying screen sizes without compromising usability.

narrative_steps.title: Switching Viewports
narrative_steps.description: Sam views the game on both a desktop browser and smartphone to compare layouts.
narrative_steps.action: Access the game on a large monitor and later on a small touchscreen device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Game board scales appropriately, maintaining 4x4 proportions, with readable text and tappable controls on smaller screens.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Desktop Window
narrative_steps.description: On desktop, Sam manually resizes the browser window to simulate different resolutions.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the browser window edges to adjust width.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout recalculates fluidly, adapting spacing, font sizes, and tile dimensions according to predefined breakpoints.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with install:all and dev scripts for frontend
user_persona: A developer setting up the project locally for contributions or testing.
user_goal: To get the development environment running smoothly using standard npm commands.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Devon clones the repository and prepares to run the app locally.
narrative_steps.action: Run command `npm run install:all` in terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies install successfully without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Development Server
narrative_steps.description: Once installed, Devon starts the local servers to begin coding or testing.
narrative_steps.action: Run command `npm run dev` in terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend services launch concurrently, allowing simultaneous development and debugging.
